meanings.sent1: The unexpected question in class discomfited the shy student.
meanings.sent2: The awkward silence during the meeting was discomfiting for everyone.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at dancing was so discomfiting that it made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead were discomfiting, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house was discomfiting, sending shivers down their spines.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel awkward or uncomfortable.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected question in class discomfited the shy student.
meanings.sent2: The awkward silence during the meeting was discomfiting for everyone.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at dancing was so discomfiting that it made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead were discomfiting, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house was discomfiting, sending shivers down their spines.
